{{for|the actor's son|Damon Wayans Jr.}} {{Use mdy dates|date=June 2016}} {{Infobox comedian | name = Damon Kyle Wayans | image = Damon Wayans.JPG | image_size = 200px | caption = | birth_name = Damon Kyle Wayans | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1960|9|4}} | birth_place = [[New York City]], [[New York (state)|New York]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | other_names = d.waynes the d man | medium = Stand-up, television, film, books | nationality = American | active = 1981–present | spouse = Lisa Thorner
(m. 1984; div. 2000) | children = 4, including [[Damon Wayans Jr.]] | relatives = See [[Wayans family]] | family = | genre = [[Observational comedy]], [[improvisational comedy]], satire/[[political satire]] | subject = Family, children, parenting, marriage, American politics, everyday life | influences = | notable_work = ''[[Saturday Night Live]]''
''[[In Living Color]]''
Maj. Benson Winifred Payne in ''[[Major Payne]]''
Michael Kyle in ''[[My Wife and Kids]]''
Roger Murtaugh in ''[[Lethal Weapon (TV series)|Lethal Weapon]]'' }} '''Damon Kyle Wayans Sr.''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|d|eɪ|m|ə|n|_|ˈ|w|eɪ|.|ə|n|z}};[http://www.sos.mo.gov/wolfner/SayHow/?id=w You nay it how?] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100527225135/http://www.sos.mo.gov/wolfner/SayHow/?id=w |date=May 27, 2010 }} born September 4, 1960){{cite web| url=http://www.biography.com/people/damon-wayans-538728#profile| title=Damon Wayans Biography: Film Actor, Television Actor, Comedian, Director, Producer (1960–)| publisher=[[Biography.com]] ([[FYI (TV channel)|FYI]] / [[A&E Networks]])| accessdate=September 6, 2015| deadurl=no| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151105122000/http://www.biography.com/people/damon-wayans-538728#profile| archivedate=November 5, 2015| df=mdy-all}} is an American [[stand-up comedian]], [[actor]], [[writer]] and [[Television producer|producer]], and member of the [[Wayans family]] of entertainers. Wayans performed as a comedian and actor throughout the 1980s, including a yearlong stint on the sketch comedy series ''[[Saturday Night Live]].'' His true breakthrough, however, came as a co-creator and performer on his own sketch comedy show, ''[[In Living Color]]'', from 1990 to 1992. Since then he has starred in a number of films and television shows, some of which he has co-produced or co-written, including ''[[The Last Boy Scout]]'' and ''[[Major Payne]]'', and the sitcom ''[[My Wife and Kids]]''. ==Early life== Wayans was born in [[Harlem]]{{cite news |title= Militant Wayans is mellowing out |work= Chicago Sun-Times |date= April 14, 1989 |first= Ernest |last= Tucker |page= 9 |url= http://infoweb.newsbank.com/iw-search/we/InfoWeb?p_product=AWNB&p_theme=aggregated5&p_action=doc&p_docid=0EB36E4E42041A1B&p_docnum=108&p_queryname=3 }} in New York City, the son of Elvira Alethia (Green), a homemaker, singer{{cite web|url=http://twit.tv/show/triangulation/175|title=Triangulation 175 Damon Wayans - TWiT.TV|website=TWiT.tv|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141112043043/http://twit.tv/show/triangulation/175|archivedate=November 12, 2014|df=mdy-all}} and social worker, and Howell Stouten Wayans, a supermarket manager.{{cite web |url=https://www.pbs.org/weta/finding-your-roots/blog/keenen-ivory-wayans-interactive-family-tree/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-08 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170110054204/http://www.pbs.org/weta/finding-your-roots/blog/keenen-ivory-wayans-interactive-family-tree/ |archivedate=January 10, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}{{cite web|url=http://www.filmreference.com/film/73/Shawn-Wayans.html|title=Shawn Wayans Biography (1971-)|website=www.filmreference.com|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080428203043/http://www.filmreference.com/film/73/Shawn-Wayans.html|archivedate=April 28, 2008|df=mdy-all}}{{cite web|url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,997920,00.html|title=Marlon Wayans|first=Joel|last=Stein|date=September 11, 2000|publisher=|via=www.time.com|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081219062051/http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,997920,00.html|archivedate=December 19, 2008|df=mdy-all}}[http://www.themoviechicks.com/mid2004/mctladykillers.html The Movie Chicks – Interview – Marlon Wayans] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080611153550/http://www.themoviechicks.com/mid2004/mctladykillers.html |date=June 11, 2008 }}Stated on ''[[Finding Your Roots]]'', January 19, 2016, PBS He has five sisters, Elvira, Vonnie, [[Nadia Wayans|Nadia]], [[Kim Wayans|Kim]], Diedre, and four brothers, actors [[Marlon Wayans]], [[Keenen Ivory Wayans]], [[Shawn Wayans]], and [[Dwayne Wayans]]. He was [[club foot]]ed as a child. This attribute would also be given to his character in ''[[My Wife and Kids]]'' and his character on the short-lived cartoon series ''[[Waynehead]]''. Wayans attended [[Murry Bergtraum High School]].{{cite web|url=https://movies.yahoo.com/movie/contributor/1800060529/bio|title=Damon Wayans Biography – Yahoo! Movies|publisher=|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110628203936/http://movies.yahoo.com/movie/contributor/1800060529/bio|archivedate=June 28, 2011|df=mdy-all}} == Career == Damon started doing stand-up comedy in 1982. His earliest film appearance was a brief cameo as an effeminate hotel employee in the 1984 [[Eddie Murphy]] film ''[[Beverly Hills Cop]]''. From 1985 to 1986, he appeared on ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' as a featured performer, before getting fired after just seven episodes for improvising during a live sketch, playing his character as a flamboyant gay cop instead of a straight cop. Wayans later claimed that he wanted to be fired due to lack of creative freedom and screen time. Wayans further explained that [[Lorne Michaels]] did not want Wayans to do too much too soon and begin drawing unfair comparisons to Eddie Murphy who had just left the show.{{cite news|last1=McCarthy|first1=Sean L.|title=What Damon Wayans said in 2015 about getting fired at SNL, In Living Color, Kevin Hart, social media, and yes, Bill Cosby|url=http://thecomicscomic.com/2015/09/08/what-damon-wayans-said-in-2015-about-getting-fired-at-snl-in-living-color-kevin-hart-social-media-and-yes-bill-cosby/|accessdate=12 October 2017|work=The Comic's Comic|date=8 September 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171013064820/http://thecomicscomic.com/2015/09/08/what-damon-wayans-said-in-2015-about-getting-fired-at-snl-in-living-color-kevin-hart-social-media-and-yes-bill-cosby/|archivedate=October 13, 2017|df=mdy-all}} He also appeared in the syndicated TV series ''[[Solid Gold (TV series)|Solid Gold]]'' during the 1980s as a comedian. With his brother Keenen, Wayans created the [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] sketch comedy series ''[[In Living Color]]'', which had a mostly African-American cast. The show went on the air in 1990. It continued running until 1994, although Wayans left the show in 1992 to pursue a film career. After ''In Living Color'', he starred in films such as ''[[Mo' Money]]'', ''[[The Last Boy Scout]]'', ''[[Major Payne]]'', ''[[Celtic Pride]]'', ''[[Bulletproof (1996 film)|Bulletproof]]'', and ''[[The Great White Hype]]'', and wrote and starred in the film ''[[Blankman]]''. He also appeared in [[Janet Jackson]]'s video "[[The Best Things in Life Are Free]]" and was considered for the role of [[The Riddler]] in ''[[Batman Forever]]'' (the role went to [[Jim Carrey]], his co-star from ''In Living Color'' and ''[[Earth Girls Are Easy]]''). In 1996, he produced ''[[Waynehead]]'', a short-lived cartoon for the [[The WB Television Network|WB]], loosely based on his own childhood growing up in a large family, starring a poor boy with a club foot. The show only lasted a season due to poor ratings. From 1997 to 1998, he was the executive producer of ''[[413 Hope St.]]'', a short-lived drama on the [[Fox Broadcasting Company|FOX network]] starring [[Richard Roundtree]] and [[Jesse L. Martin]]. In 1998, he starred in the short-lived comedy TV series ''[[Damon (TV series)|Damon]]'', in which he played a Chicago detective. It aired on [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]]. In 1999, his ''[[The New York Times Best Seller list|''The New York Times'' bestselling]] book ''Bootleg'' with co-author David Asbery was published; it is a humorous compilation of his observations about family.{{cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/COMMUNITY/transcripts/wayans.html|title=CNN - Chatpage - Books - Damon Wayans|website=www.cnn.com|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081206004437/http://www.cnn.com/COMMUNITY/transcripts/wayans.html|archivedate=December 6, 2008|df=mdy-all}} Wayans starred in the ABC comedy series ''[[My Wife and Kids]]'' from 2001 to 2005. In 2006, he produced and starred in the [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]] [[sketch comedy]] series ''[[The Underground (TV series)|The Underground]]'', which also featured his son, [[Damon Wayans Jr.|Damon Jr.]] He also hosted the 2006 [[BET Awards]]. In 2011, he also added author of a serious fictional novel to his credits with "Red Hats" which is the story of a suicidal 65-year-old woman who finds friendship and happiness when she joins the [[Red Hat Society]]. As of 2014, Wayans continues to perform stand up comedy and has developed apps with his company of freelancers "MIMS" (Money in My Sleep). The company created applications such as Flick Dat, Diddeo[http://joonbug.com/national/almostfamous/Interview-Damon-Wayans-Sr/FIdyHTOxcY0 Interview: Damon Wayans Sr.] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140826115610/http://joonbug.com/national/almostfamous/Interview-Damon-Wayans-Sr/FIdyHTOxcY0 |date=August 26, 2014 }} Joonbug.com February 14, 2014. Accessed August 25, 2014. and VHedz. On November 12, 2015, at the Irvine Improv, Damon Wayans announced his retirement from stand-up commencing December 2015. In 2016, he was cast as [[Roger Murtaugh]] in the television version of ''[[Lethal Weapon (TV series)|Lethal Weapon]]'', a role originated by [[Danny Glover]] in the [[Lethal Weapon (franchise)#Films|film series]]. ==Awards and honors== Wayans received four [[Emmy awards]] nominations for his acting and writing in ''[[In Living Color]]''. For his role in ''[[My Wife and Kids]]'', he won the 2002 [[People's Choice Award]]s for Favorite Male Performer in a New TV Series,{{cite web|url=http://www.peopleschoice.com/pca/awards/nominees/?year=2002|title=PCA Winners - People's Choice|website=www.peopleschoice.com|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924071020/http://www.peopleschoice.com/pca/awards/nominees/?year=2002|archivedate=September 24, 2015|df=mdy-all}} and received four International Press Academy "Golden Satellite Award" nominations. == Personal life == Wayans was married to Lisa Thorner; they divorced in 2000. He has four children with Thorner: sons [[Damon Wayans Jr.]], Michael Wayans and daughters Cara Mia Wayans, Kyla Wayans; and is a grandfather. He is the uncle of [[Damien Dante Wayans]], [[Chaunté Wayans]] and [[Craig Wayans]]. Wayans is a close personal friend of both [[National Basketball Association|NBA]] legend, [[Michael Jordan]] and fellow ''[[In Living Color]]'' star, [[Jim Carrey]]. Wayans was diagnosed with [[Type 2 diabetes]] in early 2013.{{cite news|url=http://www.charlotteobserver.com/2014/05/22/4925979/damon-wayans-sr-confronts-diabetes.html|title=Damon Wayans Sr. confronts diabetes with a fork and a laugh|work=Charlotte Observer|author=Devores, Courtney|date=May 22, 2014|accessdate=August 25, 2014|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141207162807/http://www.charlotteobserver.com/2014/05/22/4925979/damon-wayans-sr-confronts-diabetes.html|archivedate=December 7, 2014|df=mdy-all}} In September 2015, Wayans defended American comedian [[Bill Cosby]] from his [[Bill Cosby sexual assault allegations|sexual assault accusations]], stating, "It's a money hustle". He continued, saying, "Forty years – listen, how big is his penis that it gives you amnesia for 40 years? If you listen to them talk, they go, 'Well, the first time…' The first time? Bitch, how many times did it happen? Just listen to what they're saying and some of them really is unrape-able. I look at them and go, 'You don't want that. Get outta here.{{'"}}{{cite news|last1=Kenneally|first1=Tim|title=Bill Cosby Scandal Blasted as a 'Money Hustle' by Damon Wayans (Video)|url=https://www.yahoo.com/celebrity/news/bill-cosby-scandal-blasted-money-hustle-damon-wayans-211911552.html|accessdate=September 6, 2015|publisher=Yahoo|date=September 4, 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Chen|first1=Joyce|title=Damon Wayans Defends Bill Cosby, Calls Accusers "Bitches" and "Unrapeable"|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/damon-wayans-defends-bill-cosbys-actions-calls-victims-b-tches-201569|accessdate=September 6, 2015|publisher=US Weekly|date=September 6, 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150906225057/http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/damon-wayans-defends-bill-cosbys-actions-calls-victims-b-tches-201569|archivedate=September 6, 2015|df=mdy-all}} == ''In Living Color'' == === Characters === *Whiz (Homeboy Shopping Network) *Homey D. Clown *Blaine Edwards (Men on...) *Handi-Man *Reverend Ed Cash *Anton Jackson *Head Detective *Tom Brothers (w/[[Keenen Ivory Wayans]]) *Oswald Bates *Maj. Benson Payne === Impressions === * [[Babyface (musician)|Babyface]] (on ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'') * [[Don King (boxing promoter)|Don King]] (on ''[[In Living Color]]'') * [[Little Richard]] (on ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' and ''[[In Living Color]]'') * [[Louis Farrakhan]] (on both ''Saturday Night Live'' and ''In Living Color'') * [[Redd Foxx]] (on ''[[In Living Color]]'') * [[Richard Pryor]] (on ''[[In Living Color]]) * [[Fab Morvan]] (on ''[[In Living Color]]'') * [[Jamie Foxx]] (on ''[[In Living Color]]'') ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size: 100%;" !
